(Accessed 7 July 2011). | homepage = [http://www.geomerics.com/ Geomerics.com] }} '''Geomerics''' is a software company based in [[Cambridge]], [[United Kingdom|UK]], that specialises in creating lighting technology for the [[video game industry]]. The company's main product is '''Enlighten''', software code that calculates indirect lighting ("[[Radiosity (3D computer graphics)|radiosity]]") in real time for live action games running on systems such as the [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]], and [[personal computer]]s. The company licenses this code to games companies for incorporation into their proprietary [[First-person shooter engine|rendering engines]].[http://www.next-gen.biz/features/codeshop-step-light Codeshop: Step Into The Light], ''[[Edge (magazine)|EDGE]]'', 18 February 2008''[[Game Developer (magazine)|Game Developer]]'', '''16''' (11), December 2009, Page 35[http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/gamesblog/2008/feb/05/becomingenlightened?INTCMP=SRCH Becoming Enlightened], Guardian Online, 05 February 2008 .Sam Martin (Geomerics), Per Einarsson (DICE) [http://www.geomerics.com/downloads/radiosity_architecture.pdf "A real-time radiosity architecture for video games 2], in ''Advances in Real-Time Rendering, SIGGRAPH 2010'' The software has also recently been recently ported to [[Nvidia|NVIDIA]]'s [[CUDA]] platform.[http://www.siggraph.org/s2011/for_attendees/real-time-live Real-Time Live!], [[SIGGRAPH]] 2011 The first system to incorporate the software is the [[Frostbite (game engine)|Frostbite 2]] engine,Kenny Magnusson (DICE) ,[http://publications.dice.se/ "Lighting you up in Battlefield 3"], GDC 2011 created by the [[Electronic Arts|EA]] [[EA Digital Illusions CE|DICE]] studio, used in in ''[[Battlefield 3]]'' (2011),''[[Edge (magazine)|EDGE]]'', May 2011, p. 28-29 and ''[[Need for Speed: The Run]]'' (2011).{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} Enlighten has also been licensed for a variety of other titles[http://www.angletechnology.com/newsfull.php?nId=92 Press release: Geomerics Sales Progress], Angle PLC, 14 April 2011. "Geomerics [has secured]... sales for seven new titles with three major publishers in the first quarter. All the new titles are with large publishers and include some of the industryâs most iconic and best selling computer games. In keeping with the games industryâs standard working practices, details of the individual titles and publishers will not be made public until those titles are released. At this time, the only information Geomerics is able to disclose is that three of these titles are scheduled to be released in calendar 2011, all of them well-known and highly regarded game franchises. including ''[[Eve Online]]''.http://www.geomerics.com/news/geomerics_ccp.html ==History== [[File:Frostbite2-realtime-radiosity.jpg|thumb|A demonstration of quasi-realtime [[Radiosity (3D computer graphics)|radiosity]] from the Frostbite 2 engine.]] The company was formed by [http://www.angletechnology.com/geometric.php Angle PLC] an LSE listed company (LSE:AGL) in 2005. The project was lead by [[Chris J. L. Doran]] as a [[spin out]] from [[University of Cambridge|Cambridge University]].[http://www.develop-online.net/features/126/Game-Changers Game Changers], ''[[Develop (magazine)|Develop]]'', February 2008 Since 2007 its Chief Executive has been Gary Lewis,Financial Times, 2 February 2007, Page 4. who prior to joining the company was the Global Chief Operating Officer at [[Take 2 Interactive]] in New York.Patrick Garratt, [http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/gary-lewis-joins-geomerics-as-ceo Gary Lewis joins Geomerics as CEO], gamesindustry.biz, 31 January 2007. Accessed (via Google cache) 5 July 2011 Enlighten has been in development since 2006 and will see major distribution with the release of ''[[Battlefield 3]]'' in 2011 and updates to ongoing [[massively multiplayer online game]] ''[[Eve Online]]''.http://www.geomerics.com/downloads/londongraphics2011.pdf According to the company, "Enlighten's revolutionary technology ensures that, for the first time, lighting can be updated in real time, in game, on today's consoles."http://www.geomerics.com/enlighten/ ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.geomerics.com/ Geomerics website] * [http://www.angletechnology.com/geometric.php Geomerics on AGL website] [[Category:Software companies of the United Kingdom]]
